_comment: Created by ianb on 01/10/2014 11:56:37 using v2.1
title: How have NHS staff sickness absence rates changed?
analysis_commentary: The national absence rate demonstrates marked seasonal fluctuation, with a peak in the late autumn/winter months and subsequent reductions. The peak absence rate shows a decline in recent years: 4.96% in December 2010, 4.48% in February 2012, 4.72% in January 2013, and 4.44% in December 2014. There has also been a reduction in average annual absence rates of the past four years: 4.40% in 2009/10, 4.16% in 2010/11, 4.12% in 2011/12, 4.24% in 2012/13, and 4.06% in 2013/14 (data not shown).
data_source: Health and Social Care Information Centre, NHS Sickness Absence Rates - April 2014
